00:00:03:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:03:040000.Dialogue: So, I got the craziest e-mail this morning.

00:00:05:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:05:210000.Dialogue: I don't mean to burst your bubble, dude, but those penile enlargement pills do not work.

00:00:10:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:10:230000.Dialogue: Believe me, I know. The e-mail I got was from the office of Stephen Hawking.

00:00:19:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:19:210000.Dialogue: He's coming to the university for a couple weeks to lecture, and he's looking for an engineer to help maintain the equipment on his wheelchair.

00:00:26:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:26:110000.Dialogue: That's amazing. You'll be like his pit crew.

00:00:31:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:31:080000.Dialogue: A word of caution: I would not do your Stephen Hawking impression in front of him.

00:00:40:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:40:180000.Dialogue: I suppose that could be considered offensive.

00:00:45:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:45:100000.Dialogue: Boy, Sheldon's going to freak out.

00:00:50:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:50:100000.Dialogue: I was actually thinking about bringing him along when I go over there so he can meet the great man.

00:00:54:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:54:150000.Dialogue: That's really nice of you, Howard.

00:00:57:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:57:090000.Dialogue: Boy, a restraining order from Stephen Hawking.

00:00:59:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:59:230000.Dialogue: It'll look so nice next to the ones he's already got from Leonard Nimoy, Carl Sagan and Stan Lee.

00:01:07:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:07:150000.Dialogue: Leonard, do you recall when I said that I was going to revolutionize humanity's understanding of the Higgs boson particle, and you said, Sheldon, it's 2:00 a.m., get out of my bedroom?

00:01:17:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:17:230000.Dialogue: Like it was ten hours ago. What about it?

00:01:21:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:21:150000.Dialogue: Well, I believe I've done it. And I'm only saying believe to sound modest, because, sweet Sam Houston, I did it.

00:01:27:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:27:070000.Dialogue: That's incredible. Oh, here. Break out the math.

00:01:30:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:30:110000.Dialogue: Oh, okay, let me see this. All right, so this particle here is the boson moving forward in time. Now, I was thinking... Howard, you go ahead and eat. This isn't going to make any sense to you.

00:01:43:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:43:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I have a working understanding of physics.

00:01:46:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:46:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, good for you, and don't stop working on it.

00:01:50:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:50:040000.Dialogue: Are you still going to tell him about you-know-who?

00:01:54:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:54:160000.Dialogue: Are you still going to introduce him?

00:02:28:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:28:000000.Dialogue: Please, please, please let me meet Hawking.

00:02:35:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:35:070000.Dialogue: No, you said, Would it help if I said I'm sorry?

00:02:38:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:38:050000.Dialogue: And you never answered me. So who owes whom an apology now?

00:02:43:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:43:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you're a condescending jerk. Why on earth would I want to do something nice for you?

00:02:48:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:48:170000.Dialogue: Um... to go to Jewish heaven?

00:02:57:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:57:100000.Dialogue: Have you met my mother? I live in Jewish hell.

00:02:59:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:59:190000.Dialogue: Howard, please. This is Stephen Hawking. Perhaps my only intellectual equal.

00:03:08:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:08:230000.Dialogue: Try to put yourself in my place. Imagine you're the sole human being living on a planet populated with nothing but dogs. And then it turns out there's another human being.

00:03:23:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:23:200000.Dialogue: Hang on. Are you saying the rest of us are dogs?

00:03:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:28:050000.Dialogue: Okay, I can see you're going to take this the wrong way. Let me try again.

00:03:32:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:32:010000.Dialogue: Imagine you're the sole human being living on a planet populated with nothing but chimps.

00:03:39:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:39:220000.Dialogue: Oh, now they're so much smarter than dogs. Have you seen them on those little bicycles?

00:03:51:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:51:180000.Dialogue: So, come on, how was the first day with Hawking?

00:03:54:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:54:070000.Dialogue: It was great. We talked about movies...

00:03:58:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:58:210000.Dialogue: I showed him some card tricks...

00:04:02:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:02:010000.Dialogue: He even let me read a couple pages from his new book.

00:04:07:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:07:060000.Dialogue: Something got you down there, bunky?

00:04:14:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:14:030000.Dialogue: Raj, you're our group historian. Has Sheldon ever begged before?

00:04:17:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:17:120000.Dialogue: Three times. He begged the Fox network not to cancel Firefly.

00:04:22:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:22:080000.Dialogue: He begged the TNT network to cancel Babylon 5.

00:04:28:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:28:110000.Dialogue: And when he got food poisoning at the Rose Bowl Parade, he begged a deity he doesn't believe in to end his life quickly.

00:04:36:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:36:070000.Dialogue: Do you understand how important Hawking is to me? When I was six years old, I dressed up as him for Halloween.

00:04:47:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:47:030000.Dialogue: No, sir, no, I took my dad's desk chair, attached a Speak & Spell to it and made my sister push me up and down the block to trick or treat.

00:04:56:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:56:200000.Dialogue: Granted most people thought I was R2-D2, but still, I got a lot of candy.

00:05:01:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:01:090000.Dialogue: You don't seem to be understanding the English word no. Maybe a different language will help. Russian: nyet. Chinese: bu. Japanese: iie. Klingon: qo'.

00:05:23:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:23:230000.Dialogue: I'm not asking for me, I'm asking for Hawking.

00:05:30:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:30:190000.Dialogue: Let me try gansta: Hells naw.

00:05:38:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:38:170000.Dialogue: Okay, look, how about this? Just give him my paper on the Higgs boson. If he sees the incredible breakthrough I've made, he'll reach out to me.

00:05:51:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:51:140000.Dialogue: That's an interesting idea. Why don't you give me a minute to talk it over with my friends?

00:06:08:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:08:120000.Dialogue: You do realize you own his ass right now.

00:06:13:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:13:170000.Dialogue: You can make him do anything you want.

00:06:15:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:15:180000.Dialogue: Yeah, I know, I'm just trying to figure out how much I want to punish him.

00:06:20:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:20:230000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Hey, fellas, I'm thinking about making some freshly brewed iced tea if anyone would like some.

00:06:30:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:30:020000.Dialogue: Bring him to his bony knees.

00:06:46:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:46:010000.Dialogue: I'll give your paper to Professor Hawking.

00:06:48:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:48:220000.Dialogue: Great, thank you! Oh, that's terrific!

00:06:52:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:52:060000.Dialogue: But in exchange, I'd like you to do a few things for me.

00:06:58:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:58:080000.Dialogue: Are you familiar with the 12 labors of Hercules?

00:07:11:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:11:120000.Dialogue: All right. What would you like me to do first?

00:07:14:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:14:230000.Dialogue: Well, I thought I'd start you off by polishing my belt buckles.

00:07:19:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:19:000000.Dialogue: Oh. By all means. When I was a boy, I would polish my Mee-Maw's silver. And she would entertain me with stories about growing up in Oklahoma. Interesting woman. She once killed a prairie dog with a gravy boat.

00:07:46:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:46:140000.Dialogue: That's a lot of belt buckles.

00:07:49:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:49:020000.Dialogue: Funny thing is, I only have one belt.

00:07:53:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:53:210000.Dialogue: Anyway, I'll let you get started. Oh, by the way, the little marks, uh, that look like water spots-- I tend to stand too close to the urinal, so...

00:08:04:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:04:200000.Dialogue: ...what you're seeing there is splash back.

00:08:10:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:10:120000.Dialogue: You make sissy on your belt buckles?

00:08:18:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:18:160000.Dialogue: Here is a black light to check them. And for your own peace of mind, you might not want to shine that around the rest of the room.

00:08:35:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:35:170000.Dialogue: Sheldon, these look great. They're like magnificent little crowns to hang over my magnificent little jewels.

00:08:46:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:46:020000.Dialogue: How'd you get them so shiny?

00:08:47:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:47:100000.Dialogue: Oh, I-I buffed them with Turtle Wax. The man down at Pep Boys says from now on, the urine should just bead up and roll right off.

00:08:55:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:55:100000.Dialogue: Way to go the extra mile. Your Mee-Maw would be proud.

00:08:59:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:59:020000.Dialogue: My Mee-Maw must never know of this.

00:09:01:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:01:130000.Dialogue: Now will you give Professor Hawking my paper?

00:09:04:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:04:180000.Dialogue: Oh, my dear boy, no. Okay. Next, this is a sexy French maid costume I bought for Bernadette. I thought it might spice things up and get her to dust my room at the same time, but I was wrong and really wrong.

00:09:21:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:21:220000.Dialogue: And you want me to return it for you?

00:09:24:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:24:010000.Dialogue: No, no, no, mon petit cherie.

00:09:41:160000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon enters in the French maid costume.
00:09:41:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:41:160000.Dialogue: What are you all staring at? You ever seen a man try to get a meeting with Stephen Hawking before?

00:10:04:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:04:160000.Dialogue: It's not Saturday night. Why are you doing your laundry?

00:10:11:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:11:020000.Dialogue: Wow, are these Amy's? Kind of trashy-- good for her.

00:10:20:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:20:130000.Dialogue: Why are you washing Howard's man panties?

00:10:25:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:25:120000.Dialogue: Because if I don't, he won't give my paper to Stephen Hawking. He's a famous physicist.

00:10:29:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:29:150000.Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, I know, he's the wheelchair dude who invented time.

00:10:40:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:40:000000.Dialogue: I don't understand, why doesn't Howard just introduce you to the guy?

00:10:43:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:43:010000.Dialogue: Because he's punishing me for being a condescending jerk. You don't think I'm condescending, do you?

00:10:56:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:56:050000.Dialogue: And yes, you love correcting people and putting them down.

00:10:58:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:58:230000.Dialogue: Au contraire. When I correct people I am raising them up.

00:11:05:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:05:110000.Dialogue: You should know, I do it for you more than anyone.

00:11:10:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:10:030000.Dialogue: Come on, you do it to feel superior. I see that twinkle in your eye when someone says who instead of whom or thinks the moon is a planet.

00:11:18:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:18:230000.Dialogue: Or Don Quixote is a book about a donkey named Hotay.

00:11:22:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:22:230000.Dialogue: See, there it is, there's that twinkle.

00:11:26:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:26:060000.Dialogue: Well, I can't help it. That's an involuntary twinkle.

00:11:30:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:30:130000.Dialogue: What do you want me to tell you, Sheldon?

00:11:32:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:32:180000.Dialogue: I want you to tell me that Howard is being mean to me for no reason.

00:11:36:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:36:150000.Dialogue: Fine, Howard is being mean to you for no reason.

00:11:47:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:11:47:170000.Dialogue: Every time I spend the night, your mom slaps me on the behind and says, Go get 'em.

00:11:53:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:53:130000.Dialogue: It's not her fault. She's getting hormone replacement therapy.

00:12:04:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:04:200000.Dialogue: Check this out, I got Sheldon to wear the French maid's costume.

00:12:10:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:10:150000.Dialogue: Hey, I gave you first crack at it.

00:12:13:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:13:170000.Dialogue: Why are you doing that? You're being mean to him.

00:12:16:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:16:220000.Dialogue: He's mean to me all the time. You've heard him tease me about not having a doctorate.

00:12:20:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:20:170000.Dialogue: If you don't want to get teased about that, get a doctorate.

00:12:29:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:29:200000.Dialogue: Oh, come on, the man torments me. I'm just letting him have a little taste of his own medicine.

00:12:35:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:35:160000.Dialogue: It's not the same thing. Sheldon doesn't know when he's being mean because the part of his brain that should know is getting a wedgie from the rest of his brain.

00:12:46:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:46:050000.Dialogue: Fine, I'll just make him do a couple more things, then I'll stop.

00:12:49:080000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:49:080000.Dialogue: No, you have to stop now.

00:12:51:040000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:12:51:040000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Bernadette, I want to remind you,

00:12:54:050000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:12:54:050000.Dialogue: you promised to take me dress shopping tomorrow!

00:13:01:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:01:210000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I can't make it, but Sheldon's going to go with you!

00:13:14:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:14:220000.Dialogue: And that's the last thing you do to him.

00:13:28:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:28:190000.Dialogue: What is it now, Mrs. Wolowitz?

00:13:31:110000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:13:31:110000.Dialogue: It's this dress! When I put my front in, my back pops out!

00:13:39:140000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:13:39:140000.Dialogue: When I put my back in, my front pops out! It's like trying to keep two dogs in a bathtub!

00:13:50:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:50:050000.Dialogue: What do you want me to do?

00:13:52:070000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:13:52:070000.Dialogue: We're gonna have to work as a team! Get in here, grab a handful, and start stuffing!

00:14:05:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:05:180000.Dialogue: SHELDON: I'm not sure how to do this.

00:14:08:170000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:08:170000.Dialogue: It's easy, just pretend you're putting away a sleeping bag.

00:14:14:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:230000.Dialogue: Sleeping bags don't usually sweat this much, but okay.

00:14:21:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:21:170000.Dialogue: Oh, if we squeeze you any tighter, you may turn into a diamond.

00:14:28:060000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:28:060000.Dialogue: You're right, who am I kidding? You should have seen me when I was young, Sheldon. The fellas used to line up and bring me boxes of candy. Why did I eat it all?!

00:14:47:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:47:230000.Dialogue: Oh... no, you know, I'm not really the holding kind of... Oh!

00:14:56:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:56:050000.Dialogue: Oh, guys, I just remembered. I got you some Hawking souvenirs.

00:15:02:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:02:190000.Dialogue: Gears and springs from his wheelchair. Pretty cool, huh?

00:15:10:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:10:010000.Dialogue: I made an adjustment on the motor drive and when I was putting it back together I could not for the life of me figure out where they went.

00:15:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:19:230000.Dialogue: I did it. Had to go to three clothing stores, but we finally found a dress that could envelop your mother.

00:15:30:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:30:130000.Dialogue: I should have sent you to the custom car cover place in Altadena. They have her pattern on file.

00:15:39:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:39:030000.Dialogue: Now will you please present my paper to Professor Hawking?

00:15:44:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:44:160000.Dialogue: Oh, for heaven's sake. I did your laundry, I pee-pee- proofed your belt buckles, I, I even sprained my wrist helping your mother lift her bosom.

00:15:57:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:57:100000.Dialogue: All right, Sheldon, there's only one thing left I want you to do. Don't worry, it's an easy one.

00:16:07:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:07:070000.Dialogue: Fine. You have very tiny hands.

00:16:14:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:14:060000.Dialogue: No... about my job. I want you to tell me I'm good at what I do.

00:16:20:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:20:150000.Dialogue: You're obviously good at what you do.

00:16:23:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:23:050000.Dialogue: Well, then why are you always ripping on me?

00:16:26:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:26:100000.Dialogue: Oh, I understand the confusion. I have never said that you are not good at what you do. It's just that what you do is not worth doing.

00:16:40:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:40:200000.Dialogue: It's nicer than anything he's ever said to me. I'd take it and run.

00:16:48:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:48:080000.Dialogue: Now will you give my paper to Hawking?

00:16:52:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:52:170000.Dialogue: I gave it to him three days ago. He was really impressed. He wants to meet you.

00:17:03:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:03:130000.Dialogue: Thank you, Howard. Please let Professor Hawking know that I'm available at his earliest convenience.

00:17:11:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:11:110000.Dialogue: I thought he might be a little more excited.

00:17:27:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:27:180000.Dialogue: Professor Hawking, it's an honor and a privilege to meet you, sir.

00:17:38:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:38:230000.Dialogue: I want to thank you for taking time to see me.

00:17:43:130000.Speaker: Hawking
00:17:43:130000.Dialogue: My pleasure. I enjoyed reading your paper very much. You clearly have a brilliant mind.

00:17:54:100000.Speaker: Hawking
00:17:54:100000.Dialogue: Your thesis that the Higgs boson is a black hole accelerating backwards through time is fascinating.

00:18:02:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:02:080000.Dialogue: Thank you. It just-- it came to me one morning in the shower.

00:18:21:140000.Speaker: Hawking
00:18:21:140000.Dialogue: You made an arithmetic mistake on page two.

00:18:32:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:32:110000.Dialogue: No, no... that can't be right. I-I don't make arithmetic mistakes.

00:18:40:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:40:220000.Dialogue: Oh, no, no, no, of course not. It's just, I was thinking... Oh, gosh, golly, I made a boo-boo, and I gave it to Stephen Hawking.
